details.description: The wall bulges out in the shape of a howling humanoid face as it twists and forms tendrils reaching for nearby creatures. This haunt is formed when a murder victim is entombed within a wall before or after their death.
details.disable: @Check[type:occultism|dc:17] (trained) to weaken the spirit, @Check[type:athletics|dc:18] (trained) to force the spirit's face back inside the wall, or @Check[type:diplomacy|dc:19] (trained) to talk down the spirit; two total successes across all skills are required to disable the haunt
details.reset: The haunt deactivates 1 minute after all creatures leave the area and resets immediately thereafter. If disabled, the haunt resets after 1 day. The haunt is permanently destroyed if the remains of the deceased are removed from the wall.
details.routine: (3 actions) The spirit attempts to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Grapple]{Grapple} up to two creatures within 10 feet with a [[/r 1d20+14 #Athletics]]{+14 Athletics modifier}, then squeezes each creature it has @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Grabbed]{Grabbed}, dealing [[/r {1d10+4}[damage]]]{1d10+4 damage}. The haunt doesn't apply a multiple attack penalty to the second attempt to Grapple.

description.value:
Trigger A creature moves adjacent to the wall where the corpse is entombed

Effect The spirit gasps and wails for aid while the wall takes on the shape of its face and roils, growing tendrils. All creatures within @Template[type:emanation|distance:10]{10 feet} must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:18] save or be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Frightened]{Frightened 1} for as long as the haunt remains active. The haunt then rolls initiative.
